Source code for havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.unittests.stressapp_unit_test

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import unittest
import sys

# Load a mock class so that Python doesn't try to import the actual autoval.py
# module which requires autotest to be installed on the system
from .mock_autoval import MockAutoval
sys.modules['validation_utils.lib.autoval'] = MockAutoval()
from ..lib.stressapp_utils import StressappUtils


[docs]class TestConfigChecki(unittest.TestCase):
    """ Unit Test for stressapp """


[docs]    def test_output_file(self):
        stress = StressappUtils()
        # This is the part of the input data from stressapp test which renders
        # the data into database, listed here  just for information
        example_input = """Stats: Found 0 hardware incidents
Stats: Completed: 26071012.00M in 600.50s 43415.80MB/s, with 0 hardware incidents, 0 errors
Stats: Memory Copy: 25272276.00M at 42118.27MB/s
Stats: File Copy: 239792.00M at 399.63MB/s
Stats: Net Copy: 0.00M at 0.00MB/s
Stats: Data Check: 0.00M at 0.00MB/s
Stats: Invert Data: 558944.00M at 931.53MB/s Stats: Disk: 0.00M at 0.00MB/s
Status: PASS - please verify no corrected errors"""

        # Expected results form of a ict assigned
        expected_dict = {"hw_incidents": "0",
                        "copy_errors": "0",
                        "total_copy_size": "26071012.00",
                        "total_copy_sec": "600.50",
                        "total_copy_speed": "43415.80",
                        "hw_incidents": "0",
                        "mem_copy_size": "25272276.00",
                        "mem_copy_speed": "42118.27",
                        "file_copy_speed": "399.63",
                        "file_copy_size": "239792.00",
                        "net_copy_speed": "0.00",
                        "net_copy_size": "0.00",
                        "data_check_speed": "0.00",
                        "data_check_size": "0.00",
                        "invert_data_size": "558944.00",
                        "invert_data_speed": "931.53",
                        "data_check_speed": "0.00",
                        "data_check_size": "0.00",
                        "Status": "PASS"}

        # Calling the Stressapp_Utils function "stress.parse_stats"
        # reading index from the list for each multiple lines
        # using assert method to comapre 2 dictl
        actual_dict = stress.parse_values(example_input)
        self.assertDictEqual(actual_dict, expected_dict, 'Actual and expected results match')


if __name__ == '__main__':
    unittest.main()
